name: txt2dcm
short_description:
txt2dcm is a commandline-tool to burn text into DICOM image pixeldata.  txt2dcm is based on DCMTK version 3.6.0 and extends DCMTK (dcmdata/apps) with an additional app "txt2dcm". 

If you are familiar with dcmdata/apps, the commandline functionality is similar to pdf2dcm. You can either pass a *.txt file or plain text as an argument to the commandline tool which is then burned into an image. You can also refer to an external DICOM file to include its DICOM patient, study and series information.

The output image dimensions are 1024x768. Depending on the amount of text, multiple slices are added into the output dcm file.

Info about generated pixeldata (8Bit Grayscale):
PhotometricInterpretation, "MONOCHROME2"
SamplesPerPixel=1
BitsAllocated=8,
BitsStored=8      
Modality=OT
ConversionType=SYN

One slice (one page of text) requires 787 KB. So far no compression is used.

To map text symbols/letters to bitmap, font "Lato-Regular.ttf" and framework "Freetype2" are used.
